<div class="pilwrap" id="security">
  <h2>
    <a href="#security" name="security" class="pilcrow"></a>
Security
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Microsoft takes the security of our software products and services seriously, which includes all source code repositories managed through our GitHub organizations, which include <a href="https://github.com/Microsoft">Microsoft</a>, <a href="https://github.com/Azure">Azure</a>, <a href="https://github.com/dotnet">DotNet</a>, <a href="https://github.com/aspnet">AspNet</a> and <a href="https://github.com/xamarin">Xamarin</a>.</p>
<p>If you believe you have found a security vulnerability in any Microsoft-owned repository that meets <a href="https://aka.ms/security.md/definition">Microsoft's definition of a security vulnerability</a>, please report it to us as described below.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="reporting-security-issues">
  <h2>
    <a href="#reporting-security-issues" name="reporting-security-issues" class="pilcrow"></a>
Reporting Security Issues
  </h2>
</div>
<p><strong>Please do not report security vulnerabilities through public GitHub issues.</strong></p>
<p>Instead, please report them to the Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) at <a href="https://aka.ms/security.md/msrc/create-report">https://msrc.microsoft.com/create-report</a>.</p>
<p>If you prefer to submit without logging in, send email to <a href="mailto:secure@microsoft.com.html">secure@microsoft.com</a>.  If possible, encrypt your message with our PGP key; please download it from the <a href="https://aka.ms/security.md/msrc/pgp">Microsoft Security Response Center PGP Key page</a>.</p>
<p>You should receive a response within 24 hours. If for some reason you do not, please follow up via email to ensure we received your original message. Additional information can be found at <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/msrc">microsoft.com/msrc</a>.</p>
<p>Please include the requested information listed below (as much as you can provide) to help us better understand the nature and scope of the possible issue:</p>
<ul>
<li>Type of issue (e.g. buffer overflow, SQL injection, cross-site scripting, etc.)</li>
<li>Full paths of source file(s) related to the manifestation of the issue</li>
<li>The location of the affected source code (tag/branch/commit or direct URL)</li>
<li>Any special configuration required to reproduce the issue</li>
<li>Step-by-step instructions to reproduce the issue</li>
<li>Proof-of-concept or exploit code (if possible)</li>
<li>Impact of the issue, including how an attacker might exploit the issue</li>
</ul>
<p>This information will help us triage your report more quickly.</p>
<p>If you are reporting for a bug bounty, more complete reports can contribute to a higher bounty award. Please visit our <a href="https://aka.ms/security.md/msrc/bounty">Microsoft Bug Bounty Program</a> page for more details about our active programs.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="preferred-languages">
  <h2>
    <a href="#preferred-languages" name="preferred-languages" class="pilcrow"></a>
Preferred Languages
  </h2>
</div>
<p>We prefer all communications to be in English.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="policy">
  <h2>
    <a href="#policy" name="policy" class="pilcrow"></a>
Policy
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Microsoft follows the principle of <a href="https://aka.ms/security.md/cvd">Coordinated Vulnerability Disclosure</a>.</p>
<!-- END MICROSOFT SECURITY.MD BLOCK -->
